class.name: PolyNode2D
class.brief_description: Represents a single polygon-based node in the hierarchy of nested polygons.
class.description: The class provides exhaustive boolean operators used to shape the outlines of nodes at run-time, similarly to CSG nodes in 3D, while also giving ability to represent nested polygons. Unlike in 3D, this class doesn't allow to use it as a collision. Instead, [PolyCollisionShape2D] is used to build collision shapes. Drawing is only done on the level of root node (see [method is_root]), and not it's children. This data structure is also used to receive solutions from clipping and offsetting operations. It's an alternative to the array-based data structures which also receive these solutions in [PolyBoolean2D]. The class has a major advantage over the [Array] structure by having an ability to properly represent the parent-child relationships of the returned polygons, but it may be more computationally expensive to process.

method.name: build_outlines
method.description: Builds outlines from selected [member operation]. Unlike [method get_outlines], returns outlines immediately without scheduling operation for the next frame, so prefer to use [method get_outlines] if you care about performance over immediate information.

method.name: clear
method.description: Removes all [PolyNode2D] children immediately. Use [method Object.call_deferred] if you want to emulate the [method Node.queue_free] behavior.

method.name: get_outlines
method.description: Returns the outlines representing this node, which may result from the clipping [member operation]. This is different from [member points].

method.name: is_inner
method.description: Tells whether this node is an inner or an outer node in the hierarchy of nested nodes. If this node has no [PolyNode2D] parent and has empty [member points], this node is considered as inner node containing outer children. If [member points] is not empty, this is an outer node.

method.name: is_root
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this node has no [PolyNode2D] as parent.

method.name: make_from_outlines
method.description: Constructs an hierarchy of nodes from an array of outer and inner outlines. New nodes are constructed to represent inner outlines with [member operation] set to [constant OP_DIFFERENCE].

method.name: new_child
method.description: Constructs a new [PolyNode2D] using vertices from supplied points.

members.member: Draws polygons and polylines antialiased. [b]Note:[/b] this property doesn't work reliably in Godot 3.2 to draw polygons, but works fine for drawing polylines.
The color used to draw the node. Texture is also modulated by this property.
If [code]true[/code], draws polygons with a solid color. Does not have an effect on polylines.
The line width used to draw polylines. Does not have an effect on polygons.
The normal map used to provide depth to the [member texture].
If [code]true[/code], this node is treated as a polyline (open line), otherwise this is a polygon (closed outline).
The boolean operation that is performed on this node. This is ignored for the first child node as the operation is between this node and the previous child of this nodes parent.
The vertices which represent the outer or inner outline of this node.
[Texture] object to draw. Only the area defined by [method get_outlines] is drawn.
Amount to offset the texture. If (0, 0) the texture's origin (its top-left corner) will be placed at the node's position.
Amount to multiply the [code]uv[/code] coordinates when using a texture. Larger values make the texture smaller, and vice versa.

signal.name: outlines_updated
signal.description: Emitted whenever the outlines are updated. Changes in local transform, [member operation] and [member points] of children triggers outlines to get updated on idle frame.

constants.constant: No operation is applied. Nodes with no operation set are able to be drawn separately from the root [PolyNode2D].
Outlines of parent and child nodes are merged together.
Outlines from the child node is subtracted from the parent's outlines.
Only intersecting outlines from parent and child nodes remain, the rest is removed.
Common area defined by intersection of outlines between the parent and child is removed, the rest outlines remain unaffected.
